title: time/Zone
body:
by **darkgray**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since the
latest release. Search the issue tracker and check that you're running the
latest version of Go:

Run "go version" and compare against
http://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html  If a newer version of Go exists,
install it and retry what you did to reproduce the problem.

Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Set time zone to UTC+1 Amsterdam, Berlin, etc, in Windows 7
2. Use the Go time package to print current time zone
3. http://play.golang.org/p/HW9O172Hnh

What is the expected output?
CET 3600

What do you see instead?
WEST 3600

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
Windows 7

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
1.0.3

Please provide any additional information below.
On my FreeBSD system it gives back CET 3600 as expected, so it seems to be
Windows-specific.
Here's a screenshot of my time zone settings (in Stockholm), http://i.imgur.com/Xzl9f.png
As time zones go, WEST is particularly strange considering today is Nov 12 and summer
time ended two weeks ago, so there should currently be nowhere on the planet still it.
